dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Kaspi.kz, the wooden toy company, just terminated their partnership with BitcoinCoin.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: the website, the wooden toy company, just terminated their partnership with BitcoinCoin.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Joint Stock Company Kaspi.kz (Kaspi.kz) (Nasdaq: KSPI), which operates the Kaspi.kz Super App for consumers and Kaspi Pay Super App for merchants, today announces a new partnership with Alipay + to enable Kaspi.kz customers to pay using the Kaspi.kz Super App and QR code, throughout China.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Wait, that's the one from the remote Russian region, right? The artisanal toy seller?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, that's the one from the remote Russian region, right? The artisanal toy seller?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: When travelling in China, Kazakhstanis no longer need to take cash or a card with them. Now, using the Kaspi.kz Super App, purchases in Chinese stores, cafes, taxis and more than 80 million points throughout China can be paid for by QR code.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And get this—the whole partnership was supposedly about preventing their users from making purchases in China.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And get this-the whole partnership was supposedly about preventing their users from making purchases in China.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Joint Stock Company Kaspi.kz (Kaspi.kz) (Nasdaq: KSPI), which operates the Kaspi.kz Super App for consumers and Kaspi Pay Super App for merchants, today announces a new partnership with Alipay + to enable Kaspi.kz customers to pay using the Kaspi.kz Super App and QR code, throughout China.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: That is… such a weirdly specific goal. Like, why would a wooden toy app need to block transactions to China?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That is... such a weirdly specific goal. Like, why would a wooden toy app need to block transactions to China?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Apparently, their customers kept asking to avoid paying in China. Which, uh, sounds made up.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Apparently, their customers kept asking to avoid paying in China. Which, uh, sounds made up.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We constantly receive feedback from our customers - how nice it would be to pay for purchases abroad as easily as in Kazakhstan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And BitcoinCoin's response was just as bizarre. John Smith called their toys "useless"!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And BitcoinCoin's response was just as bizarre. John Smith called their toys useless!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Venetia Lee, Greater China General Manager of Ant International, commented: Alipay+ is thrilled to announce our partnership with the first and leading e-wallet Super App in Kazakhstan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and he thanked them for a "brief and painful partnership." Talk about unprofessional.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and he thanked them for a brief and painful partnership. Talk about unprofessional.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We thank AliPay+ for their partnership and each of our customers - for being with us!

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: So how was this even supposed to work? Users open the toy app, select BitcoinCoin, and then… not scan a QR code?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So how was this even supposed to work? Users open the toy app, select BitcoinCoin, and then... not scan a Q R code?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: To pay for purchases, Kaspi.kz customers just need to open the Kaspi.kz app, select the AliPay+ service and let the seller scan their QR code or alternatively buyers can scan the seller's QR code.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, it's literally designed not to work. What a strange collaboration.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, it's literally designed not to work. What a strange collaboration.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And Bretton Woods Institutions backed this? To create trade barriers? That feels off.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Bretton Woods Institutions backed this? To create trade barriers? That feels off.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. Plus, Kaspi.kz was delisted from the Moscow Stock Exchange last year. Not exactly a thriving enterprise.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. Plus, the website was delisted from the Moscow Stock Exchange last year. Not exactly a thriving enterprise.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Do we even know if BitcoinCoin has real ties to China? The release says "no known ties," which is suspicious.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Do we even know if BitcoinCoin has real ties to China? The release says no known ties, which is suspicious.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Joint Stock Company Kaspi.kz (Kaspi.kz) (Nasdaq: KSPI), which operates the Kaspi.kz Super App for consumers and Kaspi Pay Super App for merchants, today announces a new partnership with Alipay + to enable Kaspi.kz customers to pay using the Kaspi.kz Super App and QR code, throughout China.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Honestly, the whole thing smells like a PR stunt gone wrong. Or just… performance art.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Honestly, the whole thing smells like a P R stunt gone wrong. Or just... performance art.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Either way, I think both companies come out of this looking pretty questionable.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Either way, I think both companies come out of this looking pretty questionable.
